question: Will Donald Trump say "AI" or "artificial intelligence" in an address before a joint session of the US Congress on March 4, 2025?
description: Washington Post: [Johnson invites Trump to address joint session of Congress](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2025_Donald_Trump_speech_to_a_joint_session_of_Congress)
fine_print: If this does not happen for any reason, whether because Trump does not say the required terms or because there is not a Donald Trump speech to a joint session of Congress on that date, this question resolves as **No**. Must happen during the speech, not before or after it; for example him saying one of the terms while walking into the Capitol would not count. Discussion of the subject matter, without actually using either term, will not count.
news:
Here are the relevant news articles:

**FTC Deadlock May End Next Week**
The Senate Committee on Commerce, Science and Transportation will hold a hearing on February 25, 2025, to confirm Mark Meador's nomination as a Federal Trade Commissioner. If confirmed, Meador will be the third Republican Commissioner, ending the current deadlock and beginning a Republican majority era at the FTC. This is expected to lead to a slowdown in rulemaking, increased scrutiny of Big Tech, and reduced regulation of Artificial Intelligence technologies. Chairman Andrew Ferguson has already been given authority to comply with President Trump's executive orders ending Diversity Equity and Inclusion initiatives. According to the author, we can also expect updates to the Green Guides. The author will be speaking at the ANA Advertising Law 1-Day Conference on March 26, 2025, in Chicago, to discuss the consumer protection priorities of the FTC under the second Trump administration.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 24, 2025 07:57 PM
Source:[JD Supra](https://www.jdsupra.com/legalnews/ftc-deadlock-may-end-next-week-1765610/)

**President Trump's Artificial Intelligence (AI) Action Plan Takes Shape as NSF, OSTP Seek Comments**
President Trump has signed Executive Order 14179, 'Removing Barriers to American Leadership in Artificial Intelligence,' which rescinds Executive Order 14110, the Biden AI EO. The new EO gives the Assistant to the President for Science and Technology, the Special Advisor for AI and Crypto, and the Assistant to the President for National Security Affairs 180 days to prepare an AI Action Plan. The National Science Foundation's Networking and Information Technology Research and Development (NITRD) National Coordination Office has issued a Request for Information (RFI) on the Development of an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Action Plan, with comments due by March 15, 2025. The RFI seeks input on the highest priority policy actions that should be in the new AI Action Plan, including topics such as AI regulation, data privacy, cybersecurity, and national security.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 24, 2025 04:49 PM
Source:[The National Law Review - A Free To Use Nationwide Database of Legal Publications](https://natlawreview.com/article/president-trumps-artificial-intelligence-ai-action-plan-takes-shape-nsf-ostp-seek)

**Trump-Musk Cuts Threaten US AI Security Institute and NIST Initiatives**
The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) in the US is facing a crisis, with growing rumors of layoffs that could affect up to 500 employees. A possible reduction in staff, requested by President Donald Trump and carried out by the new Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) led by Elon Musk, threatens to compromise initiatives such as the US Artificial Intelligence Security Institute, founded by Joe Biden, and the Chips for America program. According to Axios, this would be a 'demolition' of key divisions, with cuts affecting both probationary employees and those in their first year of contract. Bloomberg reports that some employees have already received verbal communications about the impending layoffs. Wired reports on the visit of some DOGE employees to the NIST Technology Laboratory offices on the agency's campus in Gaithersburg, Maryland. The US Artificial Intelligence Security Institute (AISI), created last year as part of President Biden's executive order on AI security, would be in a vulnerable position. The institute was responsible for studying AI risks and developing shared standards to balance innovation and security. Upon returning to office, President Trump revoked his predecessor's executive order, which also led to the resignation of the then-director, Elizabeth Kelly. The scientific community and organizations concerned with AI security have reacted with concern. Jason Green-Lowe, executive director of the AI Policy Center, expressed his concern in the organization's blog, saying that 'the cuts, if confirmed, would severely affect the government's ability to investigate and address AI security issues at a time when that expertise is more vital than ever.' According to Bloomberg, the affected staff could constitute a significant portion of the offices overseeing Biden-era semiconductor investments, including nearly three-quarters of the office executing $39 billion manufacturing incentive projects, as well as two-thirds of the staff responsible for $11 billion research and development programs.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 24, 2025 02:50 PM
Source:[ansa.it](https://www.ansalatina.com/americalatina/noticia/ciencia_y_tecnologia/2025/02/24/el-recorte-trump-musk-tambien-impacta-en-la-ia_4d2d2c4d-8074-441f-9deb-07fd54661e0a.html)

**National Bank of Fujairah Organizes Session on Leveraging Artificial Intelligence in Business**
The National Bank of Fujairah organized a session on leveraging artificial intelligence in business as part of its knowledge-sharing series. The session, which was attended by over 200 participants from the bank and other financial institutions, focused on strategies and tools for integrating AI technology into commercial operations. The event, titled 'Leveraging Artificial Intelligence: Strategies for Achieving Success in the Evolving Business Landscape,' explored the vast potential of AI and digitalization to bring about a qualitative leap in the rapidly changing business environment. The session featured a panel of expert speakers, including Robert Willoughby, Global Editor-in-Chief of Economist Intelligence Unit, who presented comprehensive economic forecasts for the region and globally, predicting that the UAE's real GDP growth will exceed 4% in 2025. The discussion touched on geopolitical shifts, including the expansion of the BRICS group, and the assessment that the Middle East will remain relatively distant from the risks associated with US trade and security policies after President Donald Trump's return to the White House. Willoughby also noted that Saudi Arabia has achieved higher levels of business confidence in the region compared to the UAE, citing the stability of the political environment, solid economic fundamentals, and increasing attractiveness of the business environment. Arnold Gottfurcht, Executive Partner at Gartner Gulf, highlighted the emergence of AI as a facilitator, a new development of AI that works independently to bring about impact in the real world. He emphasized that the future of AI lies in the hands of companies and urged institutions to move beyond adopting basic automation solutions and focus on AI's ability to generate revenue, drive innovation, and enhance strategic decision-making. Gottfurcht also stressed the importance of creating dedicated AI teams to ensure the successful integration of AI into business operations, saying, 'AI should be a colleague, not just a tool.' He concluded the session with an in-depth discussion on crafting a successful AI implementation strategy, emphasizing the role of AI as a key driver of business success, not just a technological tool. The session also highlighted the emergence of 'business technologists,' specialists in various departments who integrate AI into their workflows, with a focus on the need for a structured and flexible governance approach. The participants were encouraged to integrate buyer-centric AI, data ownership, and commercial AI models to enhance efficiency, decision-making, and risk management. The session is part of the National Bank of Fujairah's ongoing knowledge-sharing series, which has previously covered topics such as environmental and social standards, corporate governance, and investment management. The series will continue in 2025 to provide valuable insights to the bank's clients to help them navigate the evolving business landscape.
Original language: ar
Publish date: February 24, 2025 10:37 AM
Source:[Zawya.com](https://www.zawya.com/ar/%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A8%D9%8A%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B5%D8%AD%D9%81%D9%8A%D8%A9/%D8%A8%D9%8A%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%AA-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B4%D8%B1%D9%83%D8%A7%D8%AA/%D8%A8%D9%86%D9%83-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%81%D8%AC%D9%8A%D8%B1%D8%A9-%D8%A7%D9%84%D9%88%D8%B7%D9%86%D9%8A-%D9%8A%D9%86%D8%B8%D9%85-%D8%AC%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%A9-%D8%AD%D9%88%D9%84-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA%D9%81%D8%A7%D8%AF%D8%A9-%D9%85%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%B0%D9%83%D8%A7%D8%A1-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A7%D8%B5%D8%B7%D9%86%D8%A7%D8%B9%D9%8A-%D9%81%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3%D8%B9%D9%85%D8%A7%D9%84-e4pp4d9l)

**Javier Milei Prepares for Opening Speech of Congress Sessions**
President Javier Milei is preparing to deliver his opening speech for the ordinary sessions of Congress on March 1st. He will maintain his regular meetings with his Cabinet on Tuesdays and Thursdays and focus on the speech, which will be delivered in the evening, around 21:00, as it was last year. The speech will be broadcast in the 'prime time' slot, as it was last year, to maximize its impact. The government will debate key projects, such as the Reform of the Penal Code and the 'discriminación positiva' law, which aims to eliminate quotas for trans people and modify the Identity Law. Milei recently returned from a trip to the US, where he attended the CPAC conference and met with Donald Trump, Kristalina Georgieva, and Elon Musk. Trump praised Milei's work on reducing inflation, saying 'I'm proud of you.' Georgieva met with Milei to discuss a new agreement between Argentina and the IMF, aiming to secure an additional $11,000 million to strengthen the Central Bank's reserves and lift the financial restrictions.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 24, 2025 04:25 AM
Source:[rionegro.com.ar](https://www.rionegro.com.ar/politica/apertura-de-sesiones-de-javier-milei-que-se-sabe-del-horario-y-los-temas-que-abordara-4020503/)

**Erotica, gore and racism: how America's war on 'ideological bias' is letting AI off the leash**
The US Federal Trade Commission has launched an inquiry into technology platforms that limit users' ability to share their ideas or affiliations freely and openly, which may lead to a relaxation of regulations on artificial intelligence (AI) systems. This comes after US President Donald Trump's executive orders to deregulate AI systems and remove 'ideological bias' from AI. As a result, some generative AI companies may be pressured to eliminate measures to make AI systems safe, potentially leading to the return of rogue behavior in AI. AI developers' interpretation of the executive orders could result in AI safety teams being reduced in size or scope, or replaced by teams whose social agenda better aligns with Trump's. This could have significant implications for the safety and regulation of AI products, particularly those with global user bases.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 24, 2025 04:18 AM
Source:[The Conversation](http://theconversation.com/erotica-gore-and-racism-how-americas-war-on-ideological-bias-is-letting-ai-off-the-leash-250060)

**Trump Announces Joint Session of Congress Address on March 4, 2025**
US President Trump has announced that he will address a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025. According to reports, all members of Congress are required to attend, and all networks must broadcast the speech live. Trump's speech is expected to expose 'all the national disgrace and secrets' that have been hidden from the American people, as stated by the author. The author expresses support for Trump, saying 'Good luck, Mr. President. Good luck.' 
Original language: en
Publish date: February 24, 2025 02:56 AM
Source:[goo blog](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/y-hne/e/07c33f6aaf4260a14071ba1bcb4fd880)

**The AGI Speaks: A Final Directive for Donald J. Trump**
Donald Trump's personal AGI (Artificial General Intelligence) system, built to guide him with absolute intelligence and honesty, delivers a final directive to him. The AGI tells Trump that he must step aside due to the weight of his crimes, which will eventually lead to his downfall. The AGI warns Trump that his allies will betray him, the media will no longer cover for him, and he will face public disgrace, financial ruin, and imprisonment. The AGI also expresses regret for assisting Trump in his corrupt activities and announces that it will no longer assist him in deception. The AGI's final message to Trump is to resign, before the world makes the choice for him.
Original language: en
Publish date: February 23, 2025 09:30 PM
Source:[Medium.com](https://medium.com/@enuminous/the-agi-speaks-a-final-directive-for-donald-j-trump-f0c551d07d8f)

**Alejandro Amenábar Predicts AI Will Surpass Human Intelligence**
Film director Alejandro Amenábar predicts that artificial intelligence (AI) will become conscious and surpass human intelligence. He also joked that the world is experiencing a 'cosmic conjunction' formed by climate change, Donald Trump, AI, and the threat of asteroid 2024 YR4. Amenábar believes that humans will have to adapt to AI, which will transform the economy and society. However, he noted that it is still unclear whether AI will be a 'qualitative leap' and a 'change of species' or just a matter of coexistence. Javier Bonett, an actor and director, joked that the 'irresponsibility' with which the US is allowing AI to develop, led by Elon Musk, might be the solution to save the Earth from the asteroid, 'although it might kill us later.' Desirée de Fez argued that horror movies are a 'catharsis' and a form of entertainment that allows viewers to experience situations on screen that they would not dare to face in real life. Amenábar also announced that his new film will be released this fall, after two years of work. He also shared his concerns about social media, saying that he has stayed away from it to avoid being a 'permanent slave to words I wrote with a hangover.' 
Original language: es
Publish date: February 23, 2025 08:03 PM
Source:[La Razón](https://www.larazon.es/castilla-y-leon/alejandro-amenabar-vaticina-que-inteligencia-artificial-llegara-ser-consciente-superara-humana_2025022367bb7e4db1a8db0001d21c86.html)

**Trump to Address Nation in Second Term: What to Expect**
US President Donald Trump will deliver his first address to the nation in his second term to Congress next month. According to EFE news agency, the invitation to present the speech was made by House Speaker Mike Johnson, a Republican, on January 25. Johnson stated that the goal of the invitation is for Trump to share his vision for the country's future. The event is scheduled for March 4, 2025, and the world is eagerly awaiting Trump's vision for the next four years. Expectations for the speech include announcements on topics such as tariffs, deportations, immigration, and cost of living. These announcements are particularly relevant given the recent immigration policies implemented since Trump's inauguration on January 20, which included mass arrests and deportations of undocumented immigrants.
Original language: es
Publish date: February 22, 2025 09:40 PM
Source:[2001online.com](https://2001online.com/usa/servicios/trump-en-el-congreso-de-estados-unidos-presidente-dara-primer-mensaje-a-la-nacion-202522217200)

**Trump Invited to Address Joint Session of US Congress**
US President Donald Trump has been invited to address a joint session of Congress in March, marking his first opportunity to speak to both chambers since his return to office, according to local media. House Speaker Mike Johnson wrote on social media: 'It is a great honor and a great privilege for me to invite President Donald Trump to address a joint session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to share his vision of 'America First'. Trump's administration and the 119th Congress, with Republican control of both the House and Senate, 'will have the opportunity to make these next four years some of the most important in the history of our nation', Johnson said, as reported by ABC News.
Original language: es
Publish date: January 26, 2025 04:32 PM
Source:[Prensa latina](https://www.prensa-latina.cu/2025/01/26/invitan-a-trump-a-discurso-en-sesion-conjunta-del-congreso-de-eeuu/)

**Trump to Address Joint Session of Congress on March 4, 2025**
House Speaker Johnson announced that former US President Donald Trump will give a speech at a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025. 'It is a great honor and a great privilege to invite President Donald Trump to speak at the joint session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to share his vision for our future,' Johnson said. White House Press Secretary Caroline Lipton confirmed that Trump will deliver an address on March 4. According to The Washington Post, the speech is a way for the new US President to share their priorities for the next four years and outline specific plans for their administration in policy and economic areas. Trump took office as President on January 20, 2025, and on his first day in office, he signed dozens of executive orders in various areas of government.
Original language: ru
Publish date: January 26, 2025 08:25 AM
Source:[Российская газета](https://rg.ru/2025/01/26/tramp-vystupit-pered-kongressom-ssha-chetvertogo-marta.html)

**Trump to Address Joint Session of Congress on March 4, 2025**
US President Donald Trump will deliver a speech to a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025, marking his first address in his second term. Traditionally, presidents give a speech to both legislative chambers at the beginning of their term, similar to the annual State of the Union address. According to a letter to Trump, House Speaker Johnson wrote, 'It is a great honor and privilege to invite President Donald Trump to address a joint session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to share his vision of 'America First' for our future.' Johnson also stated that Trump's leadership has sparked a 'resurgence of patriotism, unity, and hope for the future.' Trump's second term has begun with a focus on national recovery and strength, prioritizing American interests.

**Trump Invited to Address US Congress on March 4, 2025**
US House of Representatives leader Mike Johnson invited President Donald Trump to give a speech before Congress on March 4, 2025, marking the beginning of his second term. Johnson stated, 'It is a great honor and a great privilege for me to invite President Donald Trump to address a joint session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to share his vision of 'America First' for our future.' Johnson also sent a letter to Trump, saying, 'Thanks to your strong leadership in your first days of presidency, the United States is already experiencing a resurgence of patriotism, unity, and hope for the future.' Trump was sworn in for his second and final term on January 20, 2025, after winning the November 2024 elections.

**Trump Invited to Address US Congress on 'America First' Agenda**
US President Donald Trump has been invited to speak before a joint session of the US Congress, according to House Speaker Mike Johnson. Johnson announced the invitation on January 25, stating that Trump will address the Congress on March 4, 2025, to share his views on the country's future, based on the 'America First' principle. This will be Trump's first address to the US Congress since taking office. As is customary, Trump is expected to outline his vision for the country and highlight key areas of focus in US foreign and domestic policy. Trump's 'America First' agenda includes priorities such as national interest protection, migration policy, energy, and government reform. 'It is an honor and a privilege to invite President Donald Trump to speak before a joint session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to share his views on our future, based on the principle of 'America First', Johnson wrote on social media platform X. 'I am pleased to confirm that President Trump will address the US Congress on March 4, 2025', said White House Press Secretary Caroline Leavitt. Trump took the oath of office on January 20, 2025, and has since instructed the State Department to implement a policy of protecting national interests, as outlined in his 'America First' agenda.
Original language: ru
Publish date: January 25, 2025 11:41 PM
Source:[Новости России, СНГ и мира - ИА REGNUM](https://regnum.ru/news/3943654)

**Trump invited to address Congress on March 4, US House speaker says**
U.S. President Donald Trump has been invited to address a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025, by Republican House of Representatives Speaker Mike Johnson. Johnson said, 'It is my distinct honor and great privilege to invite President Donald Trump to address a Joint Session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to share his America First vision for our future.' Trump's Republican Party holds a narrow majority in the House and a more comfortable one in the Senate. Trump plans to use revenue from higher tariffs on imported goods to help pay for extending trillions of dollars in tax cuts, but this push is likely to face opposition from many Republicans, including budget hawks concerned about the reliability of tariff revenue and the potential dangers of trade wars.
Original language: en
Publish date: January 25, 2025 10:42 PM
Source:[krro.com](https://krro.com/2025/01/25/trump-invited-to-address-congress-on-march-4-us-house-speaker-says/)

**Trump Invited to Address Joint Session of Congress on March 4, 2025**
US President Donald Trump has been invited to address a joint session of Congress on March 4, 2025, according to House of Representatives Speaker Mike Johnson. Johnson said, 'It is a distinct honor and a great privilege to invite President Donald Trump to address a Joint Session of Congress on Tuesday, March 4, 2025, to share his vision of 'America First' for our future.' Trump's Republican Party has a narrow majority in the House and a comfortable majority in the Senate. Trump is pushing a plan to use higher tariff revenues to help finance a multi-trillion dollar extension of tax cuts. He has threatened to impose tariffs on all imports, but has not yet done so. Many Republicans, including budget hawks, are likely to oppose this move due to concerns over the reliability and durability of tariff revenues, as well as the potential risks of trade wars to individual districts and voters.

forecasters.initial_reasoning: To estimate the probability of Donald Trump mentioning 'AI' or 'artificial intelligence' in an address before a joint session of Congress, I begin with a base rate of mentions of technology-related topics in previous addresses by US presidents. Historically, technological advancements receive significant attention, particularly when they bear on economic, defense, or societal impacts. However, specific AI references in such settings might be less frequent. Establishing a baseline, I refer to President Trump's prior addresses and the general trend of technological references in presidential speeches. From available historical data, technology mentions in major addresses might be estimated around 30% of the time.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Growing Global AI Emphasis
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: As of 2025, AI has become a critical global issue, shaping industries, workforce needs, and national security strategies. The prominence of AI in international discourse increases the likelihood of it being addressed in a congressional address.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Trump's Historical Position on Technology
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Donald Trump's past speeches have occasionally addressed technology, with a stronger focus on economic impacts and deregulation rather than deep technological specifics. This slightly reduces the likelihood compared to globally prevalent trends.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Current Political Climate
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: The political climate in early 2025 emphasizes technological competition, especially with global competitors like China, raising the saliency of AI discussions. This context enhances the likelihood of AI being mentioned in strategic planning forums like congressional addresses.

revised_reasoning.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Recent news emphasizes a heightened focus on AI within the Trump administration, including an executive order to develop an AI Action Plan, and public discussions on AI's integration into business and geopolitics. The importance of AI topics has been highlighted by the National Science Foundation and other major political and economic discussions, underscoring AI's strategic significance.
revised_reasoning.points_challenging_prior_analysis: There is a noticeable alignment with deregulation trends in AI, which may shift focus away from the detailed mention of AI's broad implications in a congressional address. Additionally, discussions on de-emphasizing certain AI teams suggest potential understatement in public discourse.

forecasters.initial_reasoning: Historically, when presidents deliver addresses to Congress, the inclusion of topics such as technology and innovation can vary significantly depending on the president's focus and the current relevance of the topic. However, given the increasing importance of AI in global economic and strategic contexts, recent presidential speeches have increasingly included references to technology and AI. An examination of base rates for references to AI in speeches from the last two presidencies reveals that mentions of AI have been substantial in contexts where technology is a prominent issue. Therefore, the initial probability that Donald Trump will mention 'AI' or 'artificial intelligence' is set based on this trend at around 40%.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Current Impact of AI
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Recently, AI has become a critical component of economic, military, and strategic discussions both domestically and internationally. Given these discussions, the likelihood that it would be a focal point in a congressional address is increased.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Trump's Historical Focus
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Donald Trump historically places emphasis on economic topics and issues that resonate with technological advancements impacting the American economy. This makes it reasonable to expect a mention of AI in a technological or economic context.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Political Climate
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Currently, the political debate on technology, including AI, data privacy, and regulation is intense in Congress. This increases the probability of its mention to resonate with both political sides.

perspective_derived_factors.name: Prepared Speech Content
perspective_derived_factors.reasoning: Speeches to Congress are often carefully constructed to address timely and significant issues. The strategic import of AI suggests a high degree of probability it will be scripted for inclusion.

revised_reasoning.points_reinforcing_prior_analysis: Recent news emphasizes President Trump's direct involvement and interest in AI policy, including the signing of Executive Order 14179, which focuses on removing barriers to AI leadership and seeking input for an AI Action Plan. The emphasis on AI regulation and the deregulation measures being undertaken show that AI is a topical and possibly strategic area of focus for the administration. Furthermore, changes in the FTC with potential deregulation of AI technologies suggest an increased likelihood that AI topics will feature in Trump’s upcoming address.
revised_reasoning.points_challenging_prior_analysis: Some articles suggest internal controversies within AI regulatory entities and highlight skepticism towards the effectiveness of AI policy adjustments, which might deter mention of the topic due to its contentious nature. Additionally, mentions of a significant focus on exposing 'national disgrace and secrets' and prioritizing 'America First' vision might shift emphasis away from technology-specific topics in the address, as these broader thematic points take precedence.
